page.title: 09FAMILY LIFE, SEAMILL
page.content: Most people in Seamill are considered to be quite well off. They own televisions, cars, computers etc. Most parents have jobs and earn enough to live in comfort. Nearly all the houses in Seamill are privately owned. Many families have a family card for the windsurfing club at the beach. The beach isn't very good for sitting on because of glass and seaweed.The beach is very good for windsurfing because of the strong winds. As Seamill is really a residential area adults have to commute to work and{children have {to travel by car or mini bus to school {in West Kilbride. {A typical day}for Mrs.E.Young (a typical Seamill mother) would start by waking the family, preparing breakfast and taking Andrew (age 4) to nursery school at 9.30am. She would then go to Mr.Young's work shop .
